name: Primary with mathematics
aboutCourse:
This programme is delivered jointly by Learners First Schools Partnership (LFSP) and The University of Huddersfield.  You will spend 80% of your time in one of our partner schools, with the other 20% spent attending training sessions facilitated by experienced Learners First partnership colleagues.  Upon successful completion of the programme, you will be awarded QTS and a PGCE.
You will be primarily based at your ‘home’ school, but will be expected to attend training sessions at various local venues.
On the training (i.e. non-salaried) route it is the responsibility of the trainee to pay the tuition-fee, but subject to eligibility they could access Student Finance if they so wished.  
You must hold an A level (or equivalent) in Maths to be considered for this course - if you have a B or above at A Level Maths you may be eligible for a training bursary of £6000.
You will be expected to attend additional training days throughout the course for the delivery of maths-specific training.
interviewProcess: Subject to eligibility checks, you will be invited to attend an online interview via APPLY, as well as email invitation from a member of the LFSP team.  At your interview, the panel will be experienced senior leaders from our  partner schools.  There will be a formal interview, and you will also be required to deliver a teaching task. Prior to the interview, you will be made aware of which year group you will deliver your teaching task to.  A decision as to whether or not you will be offered a place on this programme will be made, and you will be informed of this decision via APPLY.
howSchoolPlacementsWork:
All school placements are arranged and organised by LFSP, and you will spend time in at least 2 contrasting schools, as well as gaining additional EAL and SEND exposure.  Whilst consideration is taken with regards to the location of your placement school/s in relation to your home address, trainees should anticipate that they could possibly have to travel up to 1 hour to reach their placement school.  The average travel time to a placement school is approximately 20-30 minutes.

You’ll have the support of mentors in schools who will help you to develop your practice through observations, planning meetings, weekly tutorials, reports and in-depth lesson evaluations based around the ITT Core Content Framework.

Your university tutor will visit you in school to guide, support and evaluate your progress. There is an emphasis on practical engagement with the curriculum whilst developing your understanding of the theoretical perspectives which underpin the best models of classroom practice.
personalQualities:
* High level of motivation
* Strong work ethic
* Potential to become an effective classroom leader
* Good communicator and listener
* Patience, adaptability, resilience, team-work, imagination
* Positive expectations
* Be organized, and have great time management

Let us know why you want to teach, and provide evidence that you understand the rewards and challenges of teaching.  Previous experience is not compulsory, but if you do have relevant work/voluntary experience, please include this on your application.  Tell us about the range of relevant abilities and skills you can bring to teaching.
